main event: Observers reported a bright-colored object with a tail in the sky over Dallas, Texas in January 1965.
interesting points: The object was described as golden with a long, thin tail-like appendage,The sighting lasted for about 15 seconds,The object traveled straight and level before disappearing into the horizon,It was evaluated as a probable meteor, A separate sighting involved a larger object observed by North Texas University students which appeared larger than the moon and moved slowly in various directions.
witness description: North Texas University students along with William A. Hester
